folder: Columbia Heights & Clark Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
194-222 Columbia Heights, west side, between Clark and Pierrepont Streets, showing in the background a side view of No. Pierrepont Street.
April 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
title: Brooklyn: Columbia Heights - Clark Street

folder: Clark Street & Columbia Heights, Brooklyn, NY
text:
2-10 Clark Street, at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Columbia Heights. A view of a row of old frame houses.
June 1926.
Brown Brothers.
title: Brooklyn: Clark Street - Columbia Heights

folder: Columbia Heights & Clark Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
138-148 Columbia Heights, west side, between Clark and Pineapple Streets. The numbers in this view are from right to left. Maresi the Caterer,began business as such,(1888) at No. 80 Clinton Street, Brooklyn. He lived in the second house from the left. This house was erected for Isaac Henderson,Publisher of the Evening Post. In the next house once
lived John Freeland, collector of Internal Revenue.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
title: Brooklyn: Columbia Heights - Clark Street

folder: Columbia Heights & Clark Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
165 Columbia Heights, east side, between Clark and Pierrepont Streets.
April 4, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: Columbia Heights - Clark Street

folder: Columbia Heights & Clark Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
170-178 Columbia Heights, west side, south of Clark Street. The Shearman homestead, a land mark for the past century, was purchased by Carl Gottesman, New York Investor, who plans to erect a modern apartment on site.
1934.
title: Brooklyn: Columbia Heights - Clark Street
